workflows.creator: f21f100c-9e62-42e2-a744-061c18de134c
workflows.title: Sync subscription changes to contract
workflows.description: Update the ARR, Is Platinum, Status, Start and End dates in a salesforce contract when a change happens in a subscription

data-mapper-1.title: Map status
data-mapper-1.description: Map the netsuite subscription status to the salesforce contract status

script-1.title: Get new status
script-1.description: Get closed or terminated status if the subscription has one line with one of these status. Returns null otherwise.

storage-2.title: Store fixed status
storage-2.description: This will be the status to sync to salesforce contract

netsuite-2.title: Get Subscription Plan
netsuite-2.description: Get the subscription plan to check if subscription is platinum or not by the subscription plan code

boolean-condition-2.title: SF Contract found?
boolean-condition-2.description: Checks if a salesforce contract was found

script-3.title: Get Is Platinum
script-3.description: Check if a subscription is platinum looking at the subscription plan code

boolean-condition-1.title: Is Draft or Pending Status?
boolean-condition-1.description: For draft and pending activation status we need to check if there is any line that is closed or terminated because if the subscription is closed or terminated, but has a line that is draft, the netsuite shows as draft, but the real status would be closed or terminated.

storage-7.title: Get endDate
storage-7.description: Get the endDate to sync to the salesforce contract

salesforce-1.title: Get salesforce contract
salesforce-1.description: Get the salesforce contract by subscription netsuite id

storage-1.title: Store status
storage-1.description: Store the subscription status. This key will contain the status to sync. If the subscription is draft or pending activation we have the steps below that can change the status to sync.

netsuite-1.title: Get subscription
netsuite-1.description: Get the subscription to sync to salesforce. If we have a replacement subscription, we get the replacement, if not we use the id of the subscription.

storage-5.title: Store draft status
storage-5.description: status of subscription is draft or pending activation, and for salesforce it means draft for both cases because we don't need to trach pending activation.

boolean-condition-4.title: fix status?
boolean-condition-4.description: If the result is not null, it means we need to fix the status to sync to salesforce

storage-4.title: Store endDate
storage-4.description: End date can change if the subscription is terminated. This key will have the value to sync to salesforce.

terminate-1.title: Skip
terminate-1.description: Skip sync as the salesforce contract doesn't exist for this subscription.

script-4.title: Get ARR
script-4.description: Calculate and get the ARR based on the subscription price lines

storage-6.title: Store endDate
storage-6.description: Store the latest termination date because this is what we need to sync to salesforce for terminated subscriptions

script-2.title: Get latest termination date
script-2.description: Get the latest termination date from the terminated lines

boolean-condition-3.title: Is terminated subscription?
boolean-condition-3.description: If subscription is terminated, we are going to sync the termination end date to the contract to be the contract end date
